item.title: Clash of Clans: Complete Friend or Foe Event Guide
item.description:
Supercell's Clash of Clans has teamed up with World Wrestling Entertainment (WWE) , and there’s plenty of fun stuff waiting for players this season. Besides the Gold Rush event, the one you really don’t want to miss is the Friend or Foe event. It lets you unlock WWE-style troops, fight these special heroes in enemy villages, and pick up rewards like Ores, Champ Medals, and a cool Rumbling Goblins decor.

On top of that, you can trade your Champ Medals for extra goodies, like resources, magic items, and even brand-new Hero Equipment. This guide covers how the Clash of Clans Friend or Foe event works and how you can grab all the rewards before it’s over.

How to Play Friend or Foe Event in Clash of Clans

Friend or Foe is a limited-time event in Clash of Clans , available from April 8 to April 29 . Your goal in this event is to collect Event Tickets and trade them for rewards at the Rumbling Goblins statue at your base. The cool part is, unlike the Gold Rush event, this one is all about your personal progress, so you don’t have to rely on your clanmates.

To participate in the Friend or Foe event, all you need to do is hop into multiplayer battles and focus on destroying enemy Gold Storages and Town Halls. However, this season’s battles aren’t the usual fare. Every base, including yours, comes packed with WWE-style superstar troops. Some, like YEETer and The Disarmer, will defend your village, while others, like Giant Giant and K.A.N.E, will join the enemy sides and try to wreck your base. This means you’ll want to stay sharp, both when attacking and defending.

Each battle can score you up to 300 Event Tickets . Once you’ve got enough, just tap the Rumbling Goblins statue at your base to grab your rewards. Here’s what you can earn during the Friend or Foe event:

All Friend or Foe Event Rewards

Friend or Foe Event Milestones

Base Rewards

Paid Rewards

100 Event Tickets

1 x Giant Giant (Superstar Troop)

20 x Glowy Ores

300 Event Tickets

1 x Clan Castle Cake

500 x Champ Medals

1 x Rumbling Goblins Deco

35 x Starry Ore

The Superstar troops you unlock from the statue will enter your Army temporarily (if your Town Hall is between levels 3 and 6), and you can swap them for other troops anytime in the Barracks. These troops make it a lot easier to handle the hostile WWE troops waiting in enemy villages, so make sure to grab them and enjoy the fun while the event’s still going.

How to Get and Use Champ Medals in Clash of Clans Friend or Foe Event

Along with Event Tickets, players can also earn Champ Medals during Clash of Clans ' Friend or Foe event. It's one of the currencies you can spend in the Trader Event shop . There’s lots of stuff to pick from, but the Action Figure Hero Equipment is definitely one you’ll want—it lets the Archer Queen summon the Giant Giant during battle, which is too fun to skip. Here's a quick look at the available items:

The main way to earn more Champ Medals is by completing the Friend or Foe Reward Track in the Rumbling Goblins section. If you grab the Event Pass , you’ll receive premium rewards and even more Champ Medals. For those who want to speed things up, you can buy extra Champ Medals straight from the game shop using real money.

item.title: April 23 Will Be a Big Day for The Division 2 Fans
item.description:
Summary

  • Massive Entertainment will provide more details about The Division 2's Battle for Brooklyn DLC on April 23.
  • Speculation suggests the DLC may release between May 27 and June 10 based on previous patterns and in-game hints.

Massive Entertainment has announced a showcase for April 23, where it will reveal more details about The Division 2 's long-awaited Battle for Brooklyn DLC. While the game has continued to introduce fresh events and new mechanics through seasonal patches, its last major content drop was the Warlords of New York in 2020. That's likely why The Division 2 fans are especially excited about the upcoming reveal.

Brooklyn was originally featured in the game's pre-release trailers, but the developer later confirmed it wouldn't be included at launch. Fast-forward to 2024, the Battle for Brooklyn DLC was teased for the final days of the Year 6 content. However, Massive Entertainment later delayed The Division 2 's DLC without providing a new release window.

The DLC's delay was surely disappointing for many dedicated fans, but the community remained largely supportive, with many praising the developer for prioritizing quality. To help make up for the delay, Massive Entertainment rolled out other updates, including The Division 2' s Valentine's Event Projects Chain, which offered engaging new content. Just as fans were getting caught up in these events and patches, the company surprised everyone with the announcement of a showcase set for April 23, promising new details about the Battle for Brooklyn DLC.

How and Where to Watch The Division 2's Battle for Brooklyn Showcase

In a tweet announcing the upcoming showcase, The Division 2' s developer reassured fans that the timing and YouTube Premiere link would be shared soon. Fans eager to catch the event are encouraged to keep an eye on the game's social media channels. If the showcase follows the format of The Division 2's Warlords of New York reveal, viewers can expect a mix of cinematic and gameplay footage, developer commentary, and, most importantly, a release date.

Some veteran fans have speculated that, based on Ubisoft's previous DLC release patterns and how Massive Entertainment typically markets its updates, the Battle for Brooklyn will launch between May 27 and June 10. This speculation stems from the studio's history of announcing major content about four to five weeks before release. Adding to the theory, in-game hints suggest that Year 6 Season 3 and the upcoming Reanimated event are set to end around the same time. However, the developer has not addressed these predictions, and the exact release date remains unconfirmed. That said, the wait is likely to be short, as the April 23 showcase is expected to reveal the official launch date.

item.title: Destiny 2: Spire of the Watcher Loot Table
item.description:
With the encroaching release of Destiny 2 ’s Rite of the Nine event, which will see three Dungeons turn free-to-play, it’s a good time to memorise the Spire of the Watcher loot table so players know what weapons and armor they can obtain from each encounter. After all, Spire of the Watcher is themed after the Wild West, so whoever wants the fashion to become a cowboy in Destiny 2 will need these loot drops.

Spire of the Watcher has three encounters, and each of them offers players a range of weapons and armor pieces that they'd best be aware of, including the Spire of the Watcher exclusive exotic weapon, Hierarchy of Needs, so here’s the loot table for Destiny 2 ’s Spire of the Watcher Dungeon.

Spire of the Watcher Loot Table

Ascend the Spire (1st Encounter)

Akelous (2nd Encounter)

Persys (3rd Encounter)

Weapons

  • Terminus Horizon (Machine Gun)
  • Long Arm (Scout Rifle)
  • Seventh Seraph Carbine (Auto Rifle)

  • Terminus Horizon (Machine Gun)
  • Seventh Seraph Officer Revolver (Hand Cannon)

  • Hierarchy of Needs (Combat Bow, Solar)
  • Terminus Horizon (Machine Gun)
  • Long Arm (Scout Rifle)
  • Seventh Seraph Carbine (Auto Rifle)
  • Seventh Seraph Officer Revolver (Hand Cannon)
  • Liminal Vigil (Sidearm)
  • Wilderflight (Grenade Launcher)

Armor

  • Helmet
  • Arms
  • Legs

  • Arms
  • Chest
  • Class Item

  • Helmet
  • Arms
  • Chest
  • Legs
  • Class Item

Spire of the Watcher is accessed via The Witch Queen Dungeon Key, purchasable for Silver in the Eververse Store. Players can access Spire of the Watcher from the Directory once they head to Savathun's Throne World. Inside Spire of the Watcher, players will find cowboy-aesthetic gear and weapons, with a total of 7 guns and 5 armor pieces (per class).

First Encounter – Ascend the Spire

First Encounter Loot Table

Weapons

  • Seventh Seraph Carbine (Auto Rifle | Kinetic)
  • Terminus Horizon (Machine Gun, Arc)
  • Long Arm (Scout Rifle | Arc)

Armor

  • TM-Cogburn Cover / TM-Earp Custom Hood, TM-Moss Custom Hat (Helmet)
  • TM-Cogburn Custom Gauntlets / TM-Earp Custom Grips / TM-Moss Custom Gloves (Arms)
  • TM-Cogburn Custom Legguards / TM-Earp Custom Chaps / TM-Moss Custom Pants (Legs)

The first encounter of Spire of the Watcher involves players learning the mechanics of running arc charges to activate pylons, where they will traverse upwards to the spire. While the first encounter is not a boss fight, it can be considered rather challenging due to its length, but doing so will reward players with the potential for 3 guns and 3 armor pieces, including the cowboy hat for Warlocks and Titans .

Second Encounter – Akelous, the Siren's Current

Second Encounter Loot Table

Weapons

  • Seventh Seraph Officer Revolver (Hand Cannon | Kinetic)
  • Terminus Horizon (Machine Gun | Arc)

Armor

  • TM-Cogburn Custom Gauntlets / TM-Earp Custom Grips / TM-Moss Custom Gloves (Arms)
  • TM-Cogburn Custom Plate / TM-Earp Custom Vest / TM-Moss Custom Duster (Chest)
  • TM-Cogburn Custom Mark / TM-Earp Custom Cloaked Stetson / TM-Moss Custom Bond (Class Item)

The second encounter features the first boss for Spire of the Watcher, and it's perhaps the easiest to farm for Hunters who want to get the Class Item for their cowboy hat . While it doesn't offer the best loot, it's an easy enough encounter for those with precision damage.

Final Encounter – Persys, Primordial Ruin

Final Encounter Loot Table

Weapons

  • Hierarchy of Needs (Exotic Combat Bow | Solar)
  • Seventh Seraph Carbine (Auto Rifle | Kinetic)
  • Seventh Seraph Officer Revolver (Hand Cannon | Kinetic)
  • Liminal Vigil (Sidearm | Stasis)
  • Long Arm (Scout Rifle | Arc)
  • Wilderflight (Grenade Launcher | Void)
  • Terminus Horizon (Machine Gun | Arc)

Armor

  • TM-Cogburn Cover / TM-Earp Custom Hood, TM-Moss Custom Hat (Helmet)
  • TM-Cogburn Custom Gauntlets / TM-Earp Custom Grips / TM-Moss Custom Gloves (Arms)
  • TM-Cogburn Custom Plate / TM-Earp Custom Vest / TM-Moss Custom Duster (Chest)
  • TM-Cogburn Custom Legguards / TM-Earp Custom Chaps / TM-Moss Custom Pants (Legs)
  • TM-Cogburn Custom Mark / TM-Earp Custom Cloaked Stetson / TM-Moss Custom Bond (Class Item)

The final encounter of Spire of the Watcher grants players the chance to earn the Hierarchy of Needs upon completion, which is an Exotic Solar Combat Bow. Outside of the Hierarchy of Needs, players can earn any previous weapons and gear throughout Spire of the Watcher, along with the Wilderflight Grenade Launcher.

item.title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 - Differences Between Normal & Hardcore Mode
item.description:
Hardcore Mode is one of the best ways to experience Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 , offering players an even more challenging journey through new mechanics and by removing certain features, like map and some HUD Information, that are available on the normal difficulty. This change significantly increases the challenge for Henry , as many of the tools that help ease progression in standard play are no longer available.

For players interested in trying Hardcore Mode, it’s important to understand the key changes this difficulty brings. Below is the essential information you need to advance through the game while exploring the map and surviving this punishing version of the RPG.

Updated April 17, 2025, by Eduardo Ariedo: Hardcore Mode has finally been officially added to Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2, so the previous information on how to access this difficulty unofficially in Patch 1.2 has been removed. Additionally, new details have been included about the key changes when players choose to play on this mode instead of the standard difficulty, such as the lack of map information and the inclusion of negative perks.

What Are The Differences Between Hardcore Mode And Normal Difficulty In Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2?

Even though the normal difficulty can already be challenging for many, Hardcore Mode takes it a step further by keeping even the most familiar aspects, like combat, difficult for a longer duration. Although players can adjust to these tougher mechanics over time, the mistakes you make in Hardcore Mode tend to be far more punishing.

Players Must Choose Three Negative Perks Right At The Start

One of the trademarks of Hardcore Mode in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 , just like in the first game, is the requirement for players to select negative perks as soon as they start a new save on this difficulty. In this entry, players must choose at least three debuffs before beginning the journey, with penalties that will follow Henry throughout the entire story.

These negative perks vary in effect, ranging from simpler ones like Menace, which makes Henry’s crimes permanent but doesn’t hinder those aiming for a clean, lawful playthrough, to Punchable Face, which increases the damage players take in combat. Choosing these perks is essential to adjust the challenge level and define how punishing the Hardcore Mode in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 will be.

Perk

Summary

Bad Back

Halves carrying capacity and may cause hobbling when picking herbs or mushrooms.

Bashful

Prevents asking for directions, slows Speech XP gain by 20%, and restricts access to full bathhouse services.

Hangry Henry

Hunger lowers social stats, food restores 50% less, and digestion speeds up by 25%.

Heavy-Footed

Starts with 25 noise and causes shoes to wear out twice as fast.

Menace

Crimes leave permanent marks, repeated offenses lead to execution, and guards become harsher.

Numbskull

Experience is gained 40% slower.

Picky Eater

Food spoils 25% faster, and animals yield only 25% of the usual resources.

Punchable Face

Enemies are tougher and deliver 10% more damage, scaling with their skill.

Somnabulant

Rest depletes 40% faster and sleepwalking may inadvertently move Henry.

Sweaty

Clothes get dirty faster, and Henry’s stench makes stealth much harder.

There Is No Fast Travel In Hardcore Mode

Even on normal difficulty, fast travel in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 is limited, with only a few scattered points on the map allowing quick navigation between locations. In Hardcore Mode, however, this feature is completely removed , forcing you to traverse the vast map on foot.

For this reason, one of your top priorities should be finding a horse, which offers increased speed and makes long journeys much easier. Additionally, you can sometimes catch a ride on wagons that frequently appear in villages, though you won’t be able to control their routes precisely.

Locating Yourself On The Map Is A Difficult Task

Although you still have access to the map, Hardcore Mode adds limitations that make navigation trickier. The map does not display Henry’s exact location , so it’s easy to become disoriented, especially if you’re not familiar with the regions of Troskowitz and Kuttenberg. Extra caution is necessary when exploring enclosed or less detailed areas like forests.

Fortunately, the developers have provided several ways to help you get your bearings:

  • Ask NPCs for Directions: NPCs can mark Henry’s current location on the map.
  • Use Landmarks : Orient yourself by comparing the local environment to the landmarks shown on the map.
  • Discover New Points of Interest: Each time you find a new point of interest, it gets marked on the map, offering you a rough idea of your location.

If Henry has the Bashful perk , the ask for directions feature won’t be available.

Players Have Less Information During Combat

Combat in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 also undergoes some subtle changes in Hardcore Mode. One of them is related to enemies, who become slightly more aggressive when attacking Henry, leaving less time for players to defend or even plan a counterattack. The other change is the removal of directional indicators during attacks , making it harder to tell where a strike is coming from.

Because of this, combat in Hardcore Mode becomes more situational and should not be approached impulsively. It takes time to get used to the lack of information present in this new difficulty setting, as players must pay closer attention to how Henry positions his weapons and carefully analyze enemy movements before striking.

The HUD Provides Less Information

Hardcore Mode in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 is highly minimalist when it comes to delivering information while players explore the map. In addition to removing Henry’s position marker and combat direction indicators, this difficulty also takes away access to vital HUD elements, such as Henry’s health and stamina during combat .

As a result, players must rely more on the visual cues provided by Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 and be extra cautious when managing these two key resources. Without these details, it's easy to enter a fight against bandits thinking Henry is in good condition, only to realize mid-battle that he wasn’t ready to fight at all.

Compass Is Less Useful

Even though the compass remains at the top of the screen, it provides far less information to players in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 ’s Hardcore Mode. For instance, one of the key differences is the lack of cardinal directions , which makes it harder to determine where Henry is heading while traveling across the map.

Additionally, although points of interest are still marked on both the map and compass, they only become visible when the player is relatively close to them. So, while the compass loses many of its normal difficulty functions, it can still be used situationally, especially in villages, where shops and other marked locations often help with navigation.

12 Images
12 Images

item.title: 8 Best Video Games Set In Virtual Worlds, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Like their movie counterparts, Tron 2.0 and Tron: Evolution bring human players onto the Grid to enjoy neonpunk adventures.
  • The Wachowski sisters developed Enter The Matrix to emulate the iconic action of the movies and provide important context.
  • Split Fiction features two authors transported into their stories inside a digital realm.

The concept of a game within a game has evolved significantly since its inception in the 1980s, with some games set entirely in digital worlds to replicate the feeling of being in cyberspace. This evolution is thanks to revolutionary films such as The Matrix and Dark City , which introduced the idea of virtual realities to mainstream audiences.

In an era where the lines between reality and the digital realm continue to blur, video games exploring virtual worlds have become increasingly relevant and captivating. From first-person shooters to open-world adventures, games featuring virtual worlds not only explore unique gameplay mechanics but also provide stunning visuals.

8 Enter The Matrix

The Wachowskis Created A Game That Is Important To Matrix Canon

  • Developer: Shiny Entertainment
  • Release Date: May 14, 2003
  • Publisher: Infogrames
  • Systems: PlayStation 2, Xbox, Nintendo GameCube, PC
  • Rating: T For Teen

The Matrix franchise made audiences both fear and love the concept of an entirely digital world. The series’ creators, the Wachowski sisters, capitalized on this by developing Enter The Matrix . By choosing either Niobe or Ghost, players engage in a story that is directly linked to the events of The Matrix Reloaded and even clarifies certain scenes and plot points from that movie.

The gameplay closely resembles that of Max Payne , featuring the signature slow-motion ability seen in the films as Niobe and Ghost shoot their way through programs and agents. While it may not be flawless, at the time, it was the only way for fans to immerse themselves in The Matrix in video game form, blending running, shooting, martial arts, and cerebral storytelling into one experience.

7 Saints Row 4

Saving The Human Race As A Digital Superhero

Your comment has not been saved

Saints Row 4
8 /10
7.3 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 75 /100 Critics Rec: 56%
Released
August 20, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Intense Violence, Partial Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Use of Drugs
Developer(s)
Volition
Platform(s)
PS4, PS3, Xbox One, Xbox 360, Switch, PC, Stadia
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

The original series of Saints Row games got increasingly silly and over-the-top with each entry, and Saints Row 4 is a prime example of that, leaving behind the crime organization aspect. Instead, Saints Row 4 turns the Saints, especially Boss, into superheroes trying to save the people of Earth who are stuck in a virtual reality-like prison.

The change in direction led to a division among Saints Row fans, with some disliking how Saints Row 4 no longer resembled the older games, while others were fond of it. It helps that Saints Row gave players an open world to explore and go wild, thanks to the superpowers that made the Boss feel like a character from Marvel or DC.

6 Tron: Evolution

Programs And Viruses Battle For The Fate Of The Grid

  • Developer: Propaganda Games, SuperVillain Studios
  • Release Date: November 26, 2010
  • Publisher: Disney Interactive Studios
  • Systems: PlayStation 3, PlayStation Portable, Xbox 360, PC
  • Rating: T For Teen

Tron helped pave the way for movies like The Matrix , featuring characters in a computer world where Programs are beings with free will and thought. In Tron: Evolution , a Program known as Anon fights a virus known as Abraxas that is corrupting the Grid, resulting in a lot of running, jumping, and riding through a prequel story to Tron: Legacy .

Tron: Evolution is a simple but fun movie-licensed game that replicates the look of the movie rather well for the Xbox 360/PS3 era, even featuring the film’s soundtrack by Daft Punk. With some fun light cycle chases and hack-and-slash gameplay, it is still one of the best ways for fans of Tron: Legacy to experience the Grid.

5 Superhot

A Puzzle Shooter With A VR Twist

Your comment has not been saved

Superhot
8.6 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 82 /100 Critics Rec: 76%
Released
February 25, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Drug Reference, Violence
Developer(s)
SUPERHOT Team
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, Switch, Xbox One
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

From an experimental indie title to a massive franchise, Superhot features a protagonist playing a video game that is immersive to a dangerous degree but is addictive to play. Superhot features a unique gameplay mechanic where time only moves when the player does, so it requires forethought and precise movements to complete each scenario.

As the short but sweet campaign progresses, Superhot gets more intense, with more ways for the enigmatic red enemies to execute the player, but the same goes for the reverse. It encourages players to experiment with different items and weapons to use while also uncovering more of the story, which gets more confusing as it goes on.

4 Assassin’s Creed 2

The Animus Is A Virtual Method Of Time Traveling

Your comment has not been saved

Assassin's Creed 2
11
8.9 /10
Released
November 7, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Intense Violence, Sexual Content, Strong Language
Developer(s)
Ubisoft
Platform(s)
macOS, Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, Xbox 360, Xbox One
Powered by

Gamers spend so much time in the Assassin’s Creed games as the assassin character that it becomes easy to forget that the story of games like Assassin’s Creed 2 is being experienced through the eyes of the modern day. The Animus is essentially a virtual reality device that allows a person to relive the memories of an ancestor through a simulation.

While the first Assassin’s Creed deserves recognition, most fans suggest that newcomers start with Assassin’s Creed 2 . It raised the stakes, created an improved open world, and introduced a memorable and charismatic protagonist in Ezio Auditore da Firenze. Nearly every subsequent title would build upon the stealth and action gameplay of Assassin’s Creed 2, expanding it in various ways.

3 Tron: Identity

There's A Digital Mystery To Solve On The Grid

5 Images
5 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Tron Identity
7 /10
6 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 73 /100 Critics Rec: 63%

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

t

Bithell Games
Platform(s)
PC, Switch
OpenCritic Rating
Fair
Powered by

After a long hiatus, Disney finally continued the Tron universe with Tron: Identity , taking place after the events of Tron: Legacy and showing the Grid dealing with the aftermath of Clu’s death as a detective program known as Query investigating an explosion. It also has elements of visual novels, utilizing a mix of 3D and 2D visuals.

While it may not be as action-packed as Tron fans may expect from the franchise, it still delivers on the neonpunk atmosphere that Tron: Legacy made such an impact with. Tron: Identity also features the deepest story in the Tron universe, and, while it may be short, it features many alternate branches that can make each playthrough different depending on the player’s choices.

2 Split Fiction

Two Authors, Two Players, And Two Digital Realms Coming Together

From the same award-winning developers behind A Way Out and It Takes Two , Split Fiction is another co-op adventure, but this time, it is a virtual misadventure that blends two genres. One character is a science fiction author, and the other writes fantasy, and they are stuck inside a machine that is meant to immerse them in their respective worlds, but it glitches.

From beginning to end, Split Fiction feels like a love letter and a parody of pop culture, especially the video game world, as the machine’s malfunctions bring the characters through different worlds. From the little Easter Eggs to the blunt references, Split Fiction goes all out with fan service while still providing an entertaining thrill ride filled with difficult challenges and puzzles.

1 Tron 2.0

The Closest Thing Fans Had To An Official Tron Sequel

Before Monolith Productions was shut down in 2025, it made a name for itself with several strong first-person shooters like Tron. 2.0 . It was a game that created a sequel story to the original Tron ten years before Tron: Legacy came around, focusing on Alan Bradley’s son, Jet, on his own adventure to save the Grid from a threat.

Tron 2.0 replicates the way the original film looked but expands upon it. It’s pure neon but with all the items and environments meant to look like geometric circuit boards. It has the Identity Discs and light cycles, but it also features new weapons, such as a sniper rifle, shotgun, and SMG to make the action more engaging without losing the Tron -like visuals and sounds.
